trans-unit.source: Send a message to a control.

seg-source.mrk: Send a message to a control.

target.mrk: Send a message to a control.

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: The control identifier (controlID) as returned by a GUICtrlCreate...() function, or -1 for the last created control.

seg-source.mrk: The control identifier (controlID) as returned by a GUICtrlCreate...() function, or -1 for the last created control.

target.mrk: The control identifier (controlID) as returned by a GUICtrlCreate...() function, or -1 for the last created control.

trans-unit.source: type of message to be send to the control as defined in the Windows control documentation.

seg-source.mrk: type of message to be send to the control as defined in the Windows control documentation.

target.mrk: type of message to be send to the control as defined in the Windows control documentation.

trans-unit.source: The first param to send to the control.

seg-source.mrk: The first param to send to the control.

target.mrk: The first param to send to the control.

trans-unit.source: The second param to send to the control.

seg-source.mrk: The second param to send to the control.

target.mrk: The second param to send to the control.

trans-unit.source: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: the value returned by the SendMessage Windows API.

seg-source.mrk: the value returned by the SendMessage Windows API.

target.mrk: the value returned by the SendMessage Windows API.

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: This function allows the sending of special Windows messages directly to the control using the SendMessage API. It is used to enable special control features not available with the simple GUICtrlRead() and GUICtrlUpdate.... range of functions.

seg-source.mrk: This function allows the sending of special Windows messages directly to the control using the SendMessage API.
It is used to enable special control features not available with the simple GUICtrlRead() and GUICtrlUpdate.... range of functions.

target.mrk: This function allows the sending of special Windows messages directly to the control using the SendMessage API.
It is used to enable special control features not available with the simple GUICtrlRead() and GUICtrlUpdate.... range of functions.

trans-unit.source: The parameters (wParam and lParam) can be an integer or a string.

seg-source.mrk: The parameters (wParam and lParam) can be an integer or a string.

target.mrk: The parameters (wParam and lParam) can be an integer or a string.

trans-unit.source: GUICtrlSendMsg() should be used for messages that have no special return types. For more advanced messages where you must be able to receive extra data you must use GUICtrlRecvMsg().

seg-source.mrk: GUICtrlSendMsg() should be used for messages that have no special return types.
For more advanced messages where you must be able to receive extra data you must use GUICtrlRecvMsg().

target.mrk: GUICtrlSendMsg() should be used for messages that have no special return types.
For more advanced messages where you must be able to receive extra data you must use GUICtrlRecvMsg().

trans-unit.source: Send the message $PBM_SETMARQUEE and wParam of 1 to start the scrolling marquee.

seg-source.mrk: Send the message $PBM_SETMARQUEE and wParam of 1 to start the scrolling marquee.

trans-unit.source: Send the message $PBM_SETMARQUEE and wParam of 0 to stop the scrolling marquee.

target.mrk: Send the message $PBM_SETMARQUEE and wParam of 0 to stop the scrolling marquee.
